In contrast, the behavior "waypt_return" is specifically designed to guide the vehicle back to its initial position while considering obstacles and maintaining a safe path.
  1.3) Using the behavior "waypt_return" allows the vehicle to follow a predefined route or path that ensures it returns to the starting position efficiently. The behavior "none" does not offer any guidance or route planning capabilities.

Why is alpha not active with any behavior instead of being idle?

Explanations:
1) The vehicle is currently not deployed and there is no need for it to exhibit any active behavior. It is in an idle state as there is no objective or task assigned to it.
2) Alpha has completed its objective and is now waiting for further instructions. Therefore, it remains idle until it receives a new objective or command from the control center (C2).
3) The vehicle may be experiencing technical difficulties or is undergoing maintenance, which is why it is in an idle state and not exhibiting any behavior.
